storyTitle: As Employee, I want to view my daily schedule to plan my workday effectively

testCases.title: Validate successful daily schedule display for authenticated employee
preconditions: Employee has valid login credentials
Employee has assigned shifts in the schedule database for the current day
Web portal is accessible and operational
Employee schedule database is populated with accurate data
OAuth2 authentication service is running

steps.action: Navigate to the web portal login page
steps.expectedResult: Login page is displayed with username and password fields

steps.action: Enter valid employee credentials and click Login button
steps.expectedResult: Login successful and employee dashboard is displayed

steps.action: Click on the Schedule section from the navigation menu
steps.expectedResult: Daily schedule page is displayed showing the current date

steps.action: Verify the current day is highlighted on the schedule view
steps.expectedResult: Current day is visually highlighted for easy identification

steps.action: Review the displayed shift start time for the current day
steps.expectedResult: Shift start time matches the employee's assigned shift in the database

steps.action: Review the displayed shift end time for the current day
steps.expectedResult: Shift end time matches the employee's assigned shift in the database

steps.action: Verify the location information displayed for the shift
steps.expectedResult: Location matches the assigned location in the employee's schedule

steps.action: Verify the role information displayed for the shift
steps.expectedResult: Role matches the assigned role in the employee's schedule

steps.action: Check that all schedule details are complete and accurate
steps.expectedResult: Schedule details are accurate, complete, and match database records

postconditions: Employee remains logged in
Daily schedule page remains accessible
No errors are logged in the system
Session remains active

testCases.title: Verify navigation between days in schedule view
preconditions: Employee is logged into the web portal
Employee is on the daily schedule page
Schedule data exists for previous and next days
Navigation buttons are visible and enabled

steps.action: Note the current date displayed on the daily schedule page
steps.expectedResult: Current date is clearly visible and matches today's date

steps.action: Click the 'Next Day' button
steps.expectedResult: Page refreshes and displays the schedule for the next day

steps.action: Verify the date displayed has incremented by one day
steps.expectedResult: Date shown is one day after the previous date

steps.action: Verify shift details are displayed for the next day if shifts exist
steps.expectedResult: Shift details for the next day are displayed correctly or 'No shifts scheduled' message appears

steps.action: Click the 'Previous Day' button twice
steps.expectedResult: Page refreshes and displays the schedule for the day before the original date

steps.action: Verify the date displayed has decremented correctly
steps.expectedResult: Date shown is one day before the original starting date

steps.action: Verify shift details are displayed for the previous day if shifts exist
steps.expectedResult: Shift details for the previous day are displayed correctly or 'No shifts scheduled' message appears

steps.action: Navigate forward and backward multiple times rapidly
steps.expectedResult: No errors occur, page loads correctly each time, and navigation is smooth

steps.action: Check browser console for any JavaScript errors
steps.expectedResult: No errors are present in the browser console

postconditions: Employee remains on the daily schedule page
Navigation buttons remain functional
No system errors are generated
Page performance remains consistent

testCases.title: Test access restriction to own schedule only
preconditions: Employee is logged into the web portal
Another employee's schedule URL is known or can be constructed
Role-based access control is configured
OAuth2 authentication is active

steps.action: Obtain or construct the schedule URL for another employee (e.g., /api/schedules/daily?employeeId=12345)
steps.expectedResult: URL is properly formatted

steps.action: Attempt to access another employee's schedule by entering the URL directly in the browser
steps.expectedResult: Access is denied and an appropriate error message is displayed (e.g., '403 Forbidden - You do not have permission to view this schedule')

steps.action: Verify that no schedule data from the other employee is visible on the page
steps.expectedResult: No unauthorized schedule data is displayed

steps.action: Check the HTTP response code in browser developer tools
steps.expectedResult: HTTP 403 Forbidden status code is returned

steps.action: Navigate back to the employee's own schedule URL
steps.expectedResult: Navigation is successful

steps.action: Access own schedule using the standard navigation menu
steps.expectedResult: Schedule is displayed successfully with all shift details

steps.action: Verify that only the logged-in employee's schedule data is visible
steps.expectedResult: Only authorized schedule data for the logged-in employee is displayed

steps.action: Inspect the page source and network requests for any data leakage
steps.expectedResult: No other employee's data is present in the page source or API responses

steps.action: Verify security logs capture the unauthorized access attempt
steps.expectedResult: Security event is logged with appropriate details

postconditions: Employee can only access their own schedule
Security measures remain active
Unauthorized access attempt is logged
No data breach has occurred

storyTitle: As Employee, I want to view my weekly schedule to plan my workweek efficiently

steps.action: Click the 'Previous Week' button twice
steps.expectedResult: Page refreshes and displays the schedule for the week before the original week

steps.expectedResult: Date range shown is 7 days before the original starting week

steps.action: Verify shift details are displayed correctly for the previous week
steps.expectedResult: Shift details for the previous week are displayed accurately or appropriate message if no shifts exist

steps.action: Navigate forward and backward between weeks multiple times rapidly
steps.expectedResult: Navigation is smooth, no errors occur, and page loads correctly each time

steps.action: Check browser console for any JavaScript errors during navigation
steps.expectedResult: No errors are present in the browser console

steps.action: Verify the calendar grid structure remains consistent during navigation
steps.expectedResult: Calendar grid displays properly with all 7 days visible for each week

postconditions: Employee remains on the weekly schedule page
Navigation buttons remain functional
No system errors are generated

testCases.title: Test shift type filtering
preconditions: Employee is logged into the web portal
Employee is on the weekly schedule view page
Employee has multiple shift types assigned in the current week (e.g., Morning, Evening, Night)
Shift type filter dropdown or options are visible on the page

steps.action: Note all shifts currently displayed in the weekly schedule
steps.expectedResult: All shifts for the week are visible with various shift types

steps.action: Locate the shift type filter control (dropdown, checkboxes, or buttons)
steps.expectedResult: Shift type filter control is visible and accessible

steps.action: Click on the shift type filter and view available options
steps.expectedResult: Filter displays all available shift types (e.g., Morning, Evening, Night, Weekend)

steps.action: Select a specific shift type from the filter (e.g., 'Morning')
steps.expectedResult: Filter selection is registered and applied

steps.action: Verify the schedule updates to show only the selected shift type
steps.expectedResult: Only shifts matching the selected type are displayed; other shift types are hidden

steps.action: Verify the shift details (time, location, role) remain accurate for displayed shifts
steps.expectedResult: Displayed shift details are complete and accurate

steps.action: Verify days without the selected shift type show appropriately
steps.expectedResult: Days without the filtered shift type appear empty or show 'No shifts of this type'

steps.action: Clear the filter or select 'All Shift Types' option
steps.expectedResult: Filter is cleared successfully

steps.action: Verify the full schedule is displayed again with all shift types
steps.expectedResult: All shifts for the week are visible again, matching the original display

steps.action: Verify that filtering does not affect the week date range or navigation
steps.expectedResult: Week date range remains the same and navigation buttons remain functional

steps.action: Apply filter, navigate to next week, and verify filter persists or resets as designed
steps.expectedResult: Filter behavior during navigation matches system design (either persists or resets appropriately)

postconditions: Employee remains on the weekly schedule page
Filter functionality remains operational
All schedule data remains intact and unmodified
No errors are generated during filtering operations

storyTitle: As Employee, I want to filter my schedule by shift type to focus on relevant assignments

testCases.title: Validate shift type filtering updates schedule display
preconditions: Employee is logged into the system with valid credentials
Employee has an active schedule with multiple shift types (morning, evening, night)
Schedule page is accessible and loaded
Shift type filter controls are visible on the schedule page

steps.action: Navigate to the schedule page
steps.expectedResult: Schedule page loads successfully displaying all shifts for the employee

steps.action: Locate the shift type filter control on the schedule page
steps.expectedResult: Shift type filter dropdown/checkbox is visible with options: Morning, Evening, Night

steps.action: Select 'Morning' shift filter from the filter control
steps.expectedResult: Schedule updates immediately to display only morning shifts, other shift types are hidden from view

steps.action: Verify the filtered schedule contains only morning shifts
steps.expectedResult: All displayed shifts are morning shifts, no evening or night shifts are visible

steps.action: Select multiple shift types by choosing 'Morning' and 'Evening' filters
steps.expectedResult: Schedule updates to show shifts matching both morning and evening types, night shifts remain hidden

steps.action: Verify the filtered schedule contains only the selected shift types
steps.expectedResult: Only morning and evening shifts are displayed, night shifts are not visible

steps.action: Clear all filters by deselecting all shift types or clicking 'Clear Filters' button
steps.expectedResult: Full schedule is displayed showing all shift types (morning, evening, and night)

steps.action: Verify all shifts are now visible
steps.expectedResult: Complete schedule with all shift types is displayed without any filtering applied

postconditions: Schedule displays all shifts without filters applied
Filter controls are reset to default state
Employee session remains active
No errors are logged in the system

testCases.title: Verify filter input validation
preconditions: Employee is logged into the system with valid credentials
Employee has access to the schedule page
Schedule page is loaded with filter controls visible
Employee has an active schedule with assigned shifts

steps.action: Navigate to the schedule page
steps.expectedResult: Schedule page loads successfully with all shifts displayed

steps.action: Locate the shift type filter input field
steps.expectedResult: Filter input control is visible and accessible

steps.action: Attempt to input an invalid filter value (e.g., special characters, SQL injection string, or non-existent shift type like 'InvalidShift')
steps.expectedResult: System displays a validation error message indicating invalid input, such as 'Invalid shift type selected' or 'Please select a valid shift type'

steps.action: Verify the schedule display remains unchanged
steps.expectedResult: Schedule continues to display the previous valid state, invalid input is ignored and not applied

steps.action: Verify the error message is clearly visible to the employee
steps.expectedResult: Error message is displayed in a prominent location near the filter control with clear text

steps.action: Correct the filter input by selecting a valid shift type (e.g., 'Evening')
steps.expectedResult: Validation error message disappears and the filter is accepted

steps.action: Verify the schedule updates with the corrected filter
steps.expectedResult: Schedule updates immediately to display only evening shifts, confirming the valid filter is applied successfully

steps.action: Verify the filtered results load within 3 seconds
steps.expectedResult: Schedule with filtered results loads and displays within the 3-second performance requirement

postconditions: Schedule displays shifts filtered by the valid shift type
No invalid data is processed or stored
Error messages are cleared after valid input
System logs validation errors appropriately
Employee session remains active and stable

storyTitle: As Employee, I want to view my monthly schedule to plan long-term commitments

testCases.title: Validate monthly schedule display with shift indicators
preconditions: Employee is logged into the system with valid credentials
Employee has assigned shifts in the current month and upcoming months
Monthly schedule view option is available in the navigation menu
System has access to the schedule database with current data

steps.action: Log into the system as an employee with valid credentials
steps.expectedResult: Employee successfully logs in and is redirected to the dashboard or home page

steps.action: Navigate to and select the 'Monthly Schedule View' option from the menu
steps.expectedResult: Monthly schedule view is activated and begins loading

steps.action: Wait for the monthly calendar to load
steps.expectedResult: Monthly calendar for the current month is displayed in calendar format with dates arranged in a grid (Sunday-Saturday or Monday-Sunday)

steps.action: Verify shift indicators are visible on dates with assigned shifts
steps.expectedResult: Dates with assigned shifts display visual indicators (e.g., colored dots, badges, or icons) showing shift presence

steps.action: Verify the current month is highlighted or clearly indicated
steps.expectedResult: Current month name and year are displayed prominently, and today's date is highlighted

steps.action: Verify the calendar loads within 5 seconds
steps.expectedResult: Monthly schedule completes loading and is fully interactive within the 5-second performance requirement

steps.action: Click the 'Next Month' navigation button
steps.expectedResult: Calendar transitions to display the next month's schedule with appropriate shift indicators

steps.action: Verify the next month's schedule is displayed correctly
steps.expectedResult: Next month's calendar is shown with correct dates and shift indicators for assigned shifts

steps.action: Hover the mouse cursor over a date with a shift indicator
steps.expectedResult: Shift details tooltip or popup appears showing shift information (e.g., shift type, time, location)

steps.action: Verify the shift details displayed are accurate and complete
steps.expectedResult: Shift details match the employee's assigned schedule including shift type, start time, end time, and any relevant notes

steps.action: Move the mouse cursor away from the shift indicator
steps.expectedResult: Shift details tooltip or popup disappears, returning to the normal calendar view

postconditions: Monthly calendar remains displayed and functional
Employee can continue navigating between months
Shift data remains accurate and unchanged
Employee session remains active
No errors are displayed or logged

storyTitle: As Employee, I want the schedule interface to be responsive so I can view my schedule on any device

testCases.title: Validate responsive layout on various devices
preconditions: Employee has valid login credentials
Schedule data is available in the system
Test devices available: desktop (1920x1080), tablet (768x1024), and mobile (375x667)
Supported browsers installed: Chrome, Firefox, Safari, Edge
Network connection is stable

steps.action: Open desktop browser (Chrome) and navigate to the schedule page URL
steps.expectedResult: Schedule page loads successfully with desktop layout displaying full navigation, sidebar, and schedule grid in multi-column format

steps.action: Verify all UI elements are properly aligned and visible on desktop screen
steps.expectedResult: All elements (header, navigation menu, schedule grid, filters, buttons) are properly positioned without horizontal scrolling

steps.action: Resize browser window to tablet dimensions (768x1024) or open on tablet device
steps.expectedResult: Layout automatically adjusts to tablet view with condensed navigation and optimized grid layout for medium screen size

steps.action: Verify all controls and content are accessible on tablet view
steps.expectedResult: All interactive elements are visible and accessible, navigation may collapse to hamburger menu, schedule grid adjusts to fit screen width

steps.action: Open schedule page on mobile browser (375x667) or resize to mobile dimensions
steps.expectedResult: Layout transforms to mobile-optimized single-column view with stacked elements and mobile-friendly navigation

steps.action: Verify all controls are accessible and usable on mobile view
steps.expectedResult: All buttons are touch-friendly (minimum 44x44px), text is readable without zooming, no horizontal scrolling required

steps.action: Test touch interactions on mobile/tablet: tap buttons, swipe schedule, scroll content
steps.expectedResult: All touch gestures work smoothly, buttons respond to taps, scrolling is fluid, no accidental clicks occur

steps.action: Rotate mobile/tablet device from portrait to landscape orientation
steps.expectedResult: Layout adjusts automatically to new orientation maintaining usability and proper element positioning

steps.action: Test on additional browsers (Firefox, Safari, Edge) on each device type
steps.expectedResult: Responsive behavior is consistent across all supported browsers with no layout breaking or functionality loss

postconditions: Schedule interface displays correctly on all tested devices
No layout issues or broken elements remain
User session remains active
Browser can be closed normally

testCases.title: Test load times on mobile network
preconditions: Employee has valid login credentials
Mobile device with 4G network connection available
Network throttling tools configured (Chrome DevTools or similar)
Schedule data is populated in the system
Browser cache is cleared
Performance measurement tool is ready (browser DevTools Network tab)

steps.action: Clear browser cache and cookies on mobile device
steps.expectedResult: Cache and cookies are successfully cleared, confirmed by browser settings

steps.action: Enable 4G network throttling in Chrome DevTools or ensure device is on actual 4G network
steps.expectedResult: Network conditions are set to 4G (approximately 4 Mbps download, 3 Mbps upload)

steps.action: Open browser DevTools Network tab and start recording performance metrics
steps.expectedResult: Network monitoring is active and ready to capture load time data

steps.action: Navigate to the schedule page URL on mobile browser
steps.expectedResult: Page begins loading and progress is visible in the browser

steps.action: Wait for page to fully load and measure the total load time from navigation start to page interactive
steps.expectedResult: Page loads completely within 3 seconds, all content is visible and interactive

steps.action: Verify DOM Content Loaded event time in DevTools
steps.expectedResult: DOM Content Loaded occurs within 2 seconds

steps.action: Verify all critical resources (CSS, JavaScript, images) load within the 3-second window
steps.expectedResult: All critical resources are loaded, page is fully functional within 3 seconds

steps.action: Test page load time on 3G network (slower connection) for comparison
steps.expectedResult: Page loads within acceptable timeframe, performance degradation is graceful

steps.action: Repeat test 3 times and calculate average load time
steps.expectedResult: Average load time across all attempts is consistently under 3 seconds on 4G network

postconditions: Performance metrics are documented
Page load time meets the 3-second requirement
Network throttling is disabled
Browser DevTools can be closed
Test results are recorded for reporting

testCases.title: Verify active view visual feedback

Employee is on the schedule page
